Datatable.LocalizationPair: Can't Occupy Systems while Fleet is Privateered.
Both you and the other empire will gain an incremental boost depending on each others' main population. The longer the Faction Pact lasts, the better the boost.
FAKE
Industry Cost
IF THIS IS DISPLAYING YOU ARE BUGGED
Admirals in Friendly Territory
Retrofit [dustColored] Cost
Repair [dustColored] Cost

Diplomacy Rework Disabled
Current Empire Development Stage
Current Science and Exploration Stage
Current Economy and Development Stage
Current Military Stage
[lifeforceColored]
[lifeforceColored]
System Development Upgrades
Faction is not currently being leeched
Faction is not yet reduced to 0 [systemDefenseColored]
Unique Improvement [industryColored] Cost reduced
+50% System [upkeepColored] if Food Rework Enabled
Terraform To Forest
Melt ice. Turn water into giant hydroponic garden. Grow trees. Profit.
Terraform To Forest
Need more water to grow a Forest in an Arid environment. And need more lore.
Enables direct terraforming of Lava, Ash, Desert and Arid into Forest
Enables direct terraforming of Barren, Ice, Arctic and Snow into Forest
1% of HP Repaired per Damage Absorbed by Hull Plating
10% of HP Repaired per Damage Absorbed by Hull Plating
20% of HP Repaired per Damage Absorbed by Hull Plating
5% of HP Repaired per Damage Absorbed by Hull Plating
Anomalous Infrastructure

The footprint of our housing is due mostly to things like food distribution networks, power, water filtration, and so on; by making use of anomalies for every possible infrastructural benefit to our population, we can further expand our communities with portal roads, water processing trees, microfactories turned towards maintenance, etc.
Communal Forums

While science is naturally restricted to those who have studied its practice, the creation of networked public forums at the local level (with galactic connections to similar forums) will allow further comments and ideas to flow in from all corners of our society, with each population addressing the biases the others which they themselves can no longer notice.
Time cannot be slowed on this System ([industryColored] queue will still be frozen by Stasis, but other system [fidsi] will be unaffected)
Temporal Stability
Through careful manipulation of tachyon particles, the system is able to stabilize the flow of time, preventing outside manipulation.
Sophon Shadows
Craver Shadows
Lumeris Shadows
Vodyani Shadows
Terran Shadows
Mezari Shadows
Sheredyn Shadows
Horatio Shadows
Riftborn Shadows
Unfallen Shadows
Vaulter Shadows
Hissho Shadows
Umbral Shadows
Nakalim Shadows
Warnings are half as long, and only take {0} [turn]
Costs depend on the number of Population in Empire
Recursive Militarization
By devoting the idle time of military personnel towards productive industrial activities, the system is able to utilize excess labor to increase industrial output.
+0.05 [industryColored] per [systemDefenseColored] Garrison Manpower
+0.05 [industryColored] per [systemDefenseColored] Garrison Manpower

+50 [dustColored] +10% Shield Capacity on Ships (Beacon) #A7AEB9#Orbital Effects:#REVERT# [juggernaut] [scienceColored]: [quadrantEconomyAndTrade], [juggernaut] [Strat00Strategic]: [Strat01titaniumColored] / [Strat02hyperiumColored] No Upkeep on non-Hero Ships
-50% Upkeep on non-Hero Ships

All Weapons forced to 50% Accuracy at all ranges

10% Crew killed per Phase
Set Hull Damage reduction to 0
This Anomaly cannot be Enhanced
Can Enhance Anomalies, once the appropriate technology is researched
Ruin
Ruinous curiosities may appear on a node after events of particular significance took place there, leaving a lasting mark
Can colonize all Non-Gas planets, with a -50% [fids] penalty until its technology is researched
Can colonize all Non-Gas planets, with a -25% [fids] penalty until its technology is researched
Can colonize all Non-Gas planets, with a -25% [fids] penalty until its technology is researched
Enhance Garden of Eden
You can use Alt + Click to force a technology to the top of the queue.
While watching a Space Battle, you can accelerate (+), slow down (-) or pause (Pause) the sequence. You can still navigate with the Free Camera.
To Colonize a System, you must first create an Outpost on one of its planets, and populate it using Outpost Actions.
Exploration ships can use Probes to either reveal Curiosities or look for isolated star systems.
You can activate the tutorial at any time through the game options.
The border of your empire grows depending on the influence of your systems. The more a system produces, the faster its border expands.
Each political ideology provides a mandatory law, guiding your strategy. In addition, you can vote more laws from the elected parties.
Cravers start as an Autocracy. Only a single party is permitted in the Senate, only the Main Population votes, and Anarchy cannot occur.

Your system can be developed by consuming luxury resources once you have unlocked the proper technology. Developing a system provides a permanent boost. Be careful about how you specialize your empire!
Trading Companies are created by building a Headquarters. It will then create Trade Routes from the star system it’s located in to all systems with a Subsidiary.
You can invest in a Trade Company from the Economy Screen in order to increase their Trade Routes' income.
Minor Civilizations provide a Faction Trait once assimilated. You can assimilate through war, or by using your Influence.
A part of your growth is converted every turn to fill your Manpower. It is then used by your ships and systems to generate troops during ground battle.
Once a Behemoth is turned into Citadel, it cannot be moved or scrapped.
The more Behemoth technologies you research, the more Behemoths you'll be able to control.
A Behemoth can be specialized into any type of ship; a support Behemoth can become a Juggernaut.
The Strategic Resource cost to fire an Obliterator decreases each turn, eventually reaching zero.
Combine a Citadel and an System Shield to completely negate any damage from Obliterator missiles.
Regular Technologies' icons are circles, Deeds are diamonds and Behemoth techs are hexagons.
Keii is generated by winning Space and Ground Battles, or by completing Deeds and Quests.
Hisshos will lose Keii if they retreat from a Battle.
Hissho take longer to settle an Outpost, and the process must be completed by using Keii (the cost in Keii decreases each turn, but is never 0).
Thanks to the Hissho Affinity, population is able to live on any planet without suffering penalty.
Always be sure to have at least one active Transmigration Beacon. You never know when an enemy fleet may come knocking!
As the Umbral Choir, all your ships are naturally Cloaked. Even the ones you buy on the Marketplace!
The more Planets on a System where you have a Sanctuary, the more difficult it is to detect for your enemies.
Your Sanctuaries will help your allies in their Ground Battles. Being the Umbral Choir and being a pal are not incompatible!
Any Backdoor you place will grant you a small [hackingSpeed] Hacking Speed bonus when Hacking through its node.
Starting a Hacking Op from a Backdoor will never trigger a security breach. This does not mean there are no Defensive Programs on the node though!
Unallocated Bandwidth will grant you a small [hackingSpeed] Hacking Speed bonus.
Hacking a Home System yields much better outcomes than a regular System. Don't forget to defend yours appropriately!
Blockading a Star System will prevent most factions from being able to colonize it
Make sure you use your influence! Laws are very powerful tools you don’t want to be missing out on.
Sophons have excellent ships, with each ship having an extra slot with no limitations.
Quality over quantity! Horatio’s ships have one less module slot then other faction’s ships, but have bonus health and shields equal to a portion of the industry cost used to produce them.
Be careful around the Lumeris! They colonize quickly and ignore blockades.
Every faction has a unique behemoth module available to them on the Juggernaut Blueprints technology.
Bombers are powerful weapons for taking out larger ships quickly; make sure you don’t neglect them.
Trade Companies are an incredibly effective way to increase your luxury resource production, though they will take time to develop.
Food is important not just for growing new populations, but also for growing your manpower.
Explorers can turn invisible once you research Vacuum Protection, allowing them to effectively scout enemy territory.

Modules with effects highlighted in #C48594#Red#REVERT# scale depending on the size of the ship. Modules with effects highlighted in #6999D5#Blue#REVERT# scale with the size and level of the ship equipping them.
Modules that require strategic resources to use often have unusual effects that could turn the tide of a battle.
Are an enemy’s defenses too potent? Try softening up their system with a few planet crackers.
A Faction Pact benefits both empires involved, with the bonus given to you being determined by the faction you are signing a pact with.
Be careful not to let your diplomatic pressure get too high, if it reaches the minimum then the other faction can make a devastating demand. Declaring war will prevent/negate this effect.
Influence is used for diplomacy, laws, and powerful repeatable system improvements. Make sure not to use it all in one place.
Controlling a majority of the systems in a constellation will provide a powerful bonus.
Once the Unfallen have vined a planet it is hard to get rid of them!
The United Empire has the ability to spend influence to instantly complete or purchase technologies, buildings, ships and resources.
The Nakalim can build a Temple on a planet, allowing them to convert nearby systems very quickly. However, this comes at the cost of reducing the natural output of that planet.
The Hissho aren’t great at controlling many systems, and compensate by mining planets with Behemoths. The economic gains from their unique mining abilities generally exceed those from colonization!

Minor populations will provide a special empire-wide bonus when there are 20 of them within your empire. Major populations will provide a powerful empire-wide bonus when there are 50 of them within your empire.

Boosting a population in the Population Overview screen will double the rate at which that population type grows, while also doubling its innate bonuses. Each population type has its own preferred resource you need to boost it with.
Every action you take will affect the political opinion of your citizens, take your actions carefully!

You do know best! Dictatorships choose which party gets to be in power twice as often, switch to whatever party suits your empire's needs. In addition to these, they get a reliable set of always available independent laws!
Republic is a great government for empires with a lot of influence to spend, their laws are much more effective than anyone else's.
If you want to pass more laws at once (at reduced cost!), Democracy is an amazing government type.
If your empire is having trouble expanding, the Federation government type would be perfect for you.
Kinetic weapons will be mostly absorbed against well-armored ships, maybe try using some energy weapons instead.
Shields are fantastic for absorbing energy weapons, but don’t underestimate their value against kinetic weapons as well.
Beams are well rounded weapons good for almost every situation, but don’t have any notable strengths.
Missiles may provide a lot of damage, but they can be shot down by enemy flak. Maybe try mixing in some Swarm Missiles with your Missiles to confuse enemy flak.
Know your opponent hasn’t been manning their ships properly? Attacking ships with boarding pods kills the crew, and once all the crew is dead you will take the ship for yourself.
Ships get a bigger damage bonus the closer they are to being completely manned.
Critical hits will ignore enemy shields and armor, allowing you to quickly shred well-defended ships.
The Blast Effect Battery can be used to utterly decimate fleets with many small ships.

Make sure you manage Approval properly! Letting your citizens get unhappy could lead to revolt. Content citizens produce more food and influence, with angry citizens producing less food and influence.
Curiosities aren’t just there to show you where resource deposits are, sometimes they have powerful weapons and buildings.
EMPs can be used to disable either an enemy’s weapons or shields. This can be a very powerful tool if you use it properly!
Invading systems will require a lot of time and effort, softening it up by sieging it for a few turns can make the battle go much more in your favor.
Minor factions are nothing to scoff at, some have powerful faction traits, others have powerful population. Acquiring them is always a boon.
Coordinators are great for absorbing powerful hits, and can be fitted with powerful modules that provide flotilla-wide buffs.
Pick your tactics cards carefully! Many have negative effects that could not only cripple your enemy, but also YOU if you use them incorrectly.
Don’t ignore your faction quest, it can provide you with powerful bonuses and abilities that will be useful to you the whole game.
You can manage your entire empire from the Empire Summary screen, without even having to look at the galaxy map.
Be careful when entering an Unfallen’s territory, the vines slow down your ships if you aren’t friendly with them, while speeding up theirs.
Need to boost sheer production of ships and buildings quickly? The Industrialist Party has the laws you need.
If you have a variety of strong population types or anomalies and want to make use of them, Ecologist Party laws are ideal.
To dominate the enemy in battle and save on the costs of your navy, use the laws of the Militarist Party.
The Pacifist Party laws are excellent for making new friends and turning a profit from galactic business like Luxuries and Trade Routes.
If you need to know your enemy and bypass their defenses, the Scientist Party can help you gain the advantage.
The Religious Party can help you build a strong economy despite a lack of territory or resources by harnessing Heroes, special nodes, and the spoils of your enemies worlds.
Plan on killing a lot of ships in the near future? Modules and hero skills that provide a resource per Command Points destroyed could give you a powerful surplus of said resource.
Don’t have any planets left to colonize? Your colonization ships could be converted into siege or invasion ships that batter an enemy’s defenses!
Trade agreements give you access to luxuries produced by other empires.
Pay attention to the innate bonuses of your populations, it could be worthwhile to send them to a more effective system.
Mercenary Ships have an improved privateering, though at an increased cost. It may be a good idea to... keep your Ally in check next time they act up.

Hot planets are great for producing industry, but tend to have terrible science. Next time you’re looking for additional industry, it may be a good idea to colonize a system with multiple hot planets.

Fertile planets are the perfect climate for growing food and holding population. If you’re wanting to grow a lot of population and quickly, a Fertile planet is your best bet. Fertile planets tend to not produce as much industry or science per population though.

Cold planets are the ideal planet type to set up some laboratories to produce research. If you’re ever feeling behind in the tech tree, a Cold planet might be the thing you need to catch up, though be wary that it will be hard to build infrastructure.

Sterile planets are good for specializing into a specific resource determined by planet temperature, and innately produce more dust than fertile planets. Though they tend to not have as many population slots as Fertile planets, they have more than a gas planet will.
Nakalim players can’t produce science from planets, meaning cold planets are entirely useless to them. This is also the ideal place to build temples, since the malus doesn’t affect you.

If you’re willing to wait, send a Warning and a Prepare for War declaration, and after the warning expires you will be able to declare war for very cheap. The best part is, if you decide it’s not worth waiting you can still declare a surprise war.
Finding diplomacy too expensive? Send a praise to another faction, it drastically lowers the cost of positive diplomacy.

All Trading Company headquarters will trade with every trading subsidiary, and vice versa. However, headquarters will not trade with each other, and similarly subsidiaries will only trade with headquarters.
Bombers do not take accuracy penalties and ignore enemy evasion, great for dealing with pesky Umbral Choir fleets.

Trade routes produce dust and luxuries primarily based on the level of development of the systems containing the headquarters and subsidiary. This enables them to scale as your overall empire develops!

Trade routes will generate luxury resources not only from the systems containing the headquarters and subsidiary, but also from the directly surrounding colonized systems. However, other systems along the trade route will NOT contribute luxuries.
The more industry something costs to build, the greater the dust cost to buyout, so buyouts can get very expensive very quickly. It’s more effective to buy out cheaper buildings than expensive ones.
The Umbral Choir is not affected by the negative effects of special nodes! Be wary of being lured into a trap.
The Umbral Choir’s beacons provide special empire-wide bonuses depending on which special node they are placed on! More beacons means more bonuses.
Economic Behemoths are powerful tools--just be sure to continue moving them to new systems so that they can help build up infrastructure in new locations!
Riftborn ships may be fragile, but they make up for it in firepower. Riftborn ships have, on average, more weapons than any other faction.

Craver ships have 10% less hp then other factions, to compensate for this that can command larger fleets, an effective strategy for dealing with these swarms is to use AOE battle effects such as the blast effect battery heavy weapon and the collateral damage battle card, both found in the military tree.

Assigning a hero to a system can be the difference between mediocrity and greatness, make sure to utilize them wisely. Similarly, assigning a hero to a fleet can be the difference between decisive victory and embarrassing defeat.
Finding the colors available to each faction to be too similar? Switch to the Saturated color palette in the settings.
All defensive hacking programs provide protection against one specific capital hack--be sure to choose wisely which outcomes are important to protect against!
Want to move populations between systems? System Modernization provides access to the spaceport, which allows you to ship populations to greener pastures.
Be careful! Pirates spawn in waves and can cripple an unprepared empire. However, if you are ready for their arrival, destroyed pirate ships are an excellent source of resources.

The circles underneath a system’s name represent planets! Unfilled circles mean that you can’t currently colonize that planet, filled means that you can colonize it. If it has a ring, then it’s a unique planet with a resource bonus. If it’s colored, another empire has an outpost or colony on it.

The circles underneath a system’s name represent planets! If they pulsate every few seconds, then they have a curiosity for you to search. If it has a rotating line around it, a faction is currently mining it.

When looking in the galaxy view, the box behind a system’s name represents its system level. If it has no border, it is level 1. If it has a bright border on the top and bottom, it is level 2. If it has a bright border on all edges, it is level 3. If it is completely filled in with a bright color, it is level 4.
The more population you have, the higher the requirement to grow the next one, and the more food your system consumes. Make sure you invest in food or your empire will stagnate.
Ships kept in a system’s hangar will have less upkeep and heal faster, but can’t participate in any military operations.
It may be worthwhile to orbit an unused fleet around a special node. Some of them increase your vision range, give beneficial combat bonuses, or provide experience gain per turn.
Be careful when passing through a Vaulter system, they can teleport any ship to any of their systems within a blink of an eye!

The Unfallen have one crippling weakness, if you take an Unfallen system, then all vined systems connected to it will be detached from the vine network and die! Taking the Unfallen’s home system means a guaranteed death for the Unfallen player.
If another faction has a system with an influence radius that covers your system, a great way to prevent them from converting it is by declaring war.
Remember, the Riftborn can’t use food when creating outposts, instead, they value high industry-producing planets like Ash, Lava, or Burning Gas.

New populations are grown once you have an accumulated stock of 300 food (scaling with game speed). Any food over this number is counted towards growing the next population, but you can only grow one population per turn. If you have too much food, there are technologies that will convert excess food stock into other resources.
Mining Behemoths are great for gathering luxury and strategic resources that would otherwise be unavailable to you.
The Hissho have the ability to add a portion of the [fidsi] on each planet they mine to every planet on their home system, allowing their single system to experience the growth of an entire empire.
Science Behemoths are great for achieving a Science Victory, and can be used to lower the science costs of technologies.
The Academy will grant its benefactors roles with powerful bonuses... to those who can win his auction.
The cost of technologies will slowly increase as you research more! Make sure you pick what you research first wisely!
Systems can store up to one turn of Industry! If you forget to queue up something to build, or you start on something that doesn't take industry to build, you'll be able to use it next turn!

You can store up to one turn of Science! This means that if you forget to queue a technology for a turn, you won't take any penalties! This also means that any Science earned through destroying ships is lost if you earn more than you naturally produce per turn!
Craft Guilds

As group micro-loans provide new supply chains and lines of credit to citizens, cottage industries of craft luxuries are booming. By organizing semi-public guilds to guide and certify these hobbyists, new supplies of fine goods can come flooding from the homes of all our citizens.
Advanced Culinary Tourism

Assisted by both normal and micro-loans to entice cooperation at all levels of society, the reorganization of brands, recipe bloggers, and restauranteurs will allow us to present a united front to the galaxy - buffet-style Sophonic geo-steaming joints, Horatic menuless fine dining, and Lumeris redsang-flavor crab chips are just a few results of this new export method.
War-Comparative Laboratories

While difficult and slow in times of peace, the application of Ontological Reverse-Engineering to warfare thrives during active conflicts. Models are built and modified based on incoming data to revise our understanding of ancient artifacts and not only compare our technology to our enemies, but also our very methods of research.
Home-Cooked Rations

With magnetic field technology cheaper and more advanced than ever, it's possible for just about anyone, anywhere to have deliveries launched into orbit with mag-catapults, making both postage and surface-to-orbit military supply easy. With the addition of standardized packaging and a solid vetting process, even the smallest country farm on the most distant world can send good food hurtling towards the front!
Predictive Groceries

By combining data from dietary trends, immigration paperwork, and coupon use, food deliveries can be directed for maximum use and minimum waste by matching populations with their preferences. By the time an Eyder visitor has reached their hotel, a bag of their preferred brand of nutri-pellet from home will already be in stock at the vending machines!
+25 [happinessColored] on Systems with one of your Fleets in Orbit
+10% Ownership recovery rate on Systems with one of your Fleets in Orbit
Lifesign Targeting

Almost all living things in the universe contain at least trace amounts of Dust, and those that don't usually become covered in the stuff anyways as a product of their environment; by attuning to the presence of Dust, this hero can locate clusters of personnel on enemy ships to be targeted with relevant weaponry.
Greased Wheels Association

Lumeris economics are built on thousands of layers of contract work, inflicting the costs of a constant arms race fought by legal funds and clever wording. By forming a jointly operated, neutral criminal body to enforce the "spirit" of contracts, a mix of threats and bribes will make sure that the larger Lumeris system is always satisfied with its service.
Roughnecks
In a galaxy full of Endless ruins and experiments-turned-wildlife, it's important to learn how to defend your mining camps with everything you've got. This faction takes that a little further.
[red]+10000 Points#REVERT#
[red]Reveal Galaxy#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait reveals the entire galaxy to you.
Gives Vision over the Entire Map
[red]Extra Food#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait provides extra Food on every system.
[red]Extra Industry#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait provides extra industry on every system.
[red]Extra Dust#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait provides extra Dust on every system.
[red]Extra Science#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait provides extra Science on every system.
[red]Extra Influence#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait provides extra Influence on every system.
[red]Extra Manpower#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait provides extra Manpower on every system.
[red]Ecstatic Empire#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait forces the approval on all systems to 100%.
[red]Extra CP#REVERT#
Someone is a big cheater! This trait provides extra CP for your empire.
Militarized Social Networks

As stellar distances grow, the clannish independence of Vaulter culture has come to the forefront, making local militia and clubs of researchers more powerful than regular armies and universities. Rather than fight this, we can use the decentralized, encrypted social media apps of our independent scholars as a foundation for militarized social media, able to organize troops without putting pressure on their desire for autonomy.
Ransacker Module
Scavenger's Code works outside of Friendly Territory on Fleet
Science Building
Military Building
Farm-to-Capital

While a certain amount of preservation is necessary for food to travel there in the first place, most processing into complete meals and ingredients is done on the homeworld, where canneries run night and day and vast food stores are maintained in case anything should ever happen to the wider empire.
Bridge Couriers

This faction has made use of smaller wormholes for transporting drones or unguided packages for a while now, and with the basic FTL necessary to use space lanes for larger ships, so too are they already prepared to make wormhole jumps.
Can See and Use Wormholes Further Research of Wormholes will decrease Movement Point Cost
Laneblazers
By miraculous accident, starlanes were not discovered nearby until other methods of FTL travel were well-researched, making them more of a pleasant convenience than a serious necessity.
Can use Free Movement Further Research of Free Movement will increase Warp Speed
Air Gondoleers

Lush peaks, toxic valleys, flying landmasses, or extremely vertical islands have forced this culture to mass produce the cheapest forms of air travel, from balloon-assisted cable cars to modern jet taxis, and this experience has extended to vast, low cost air fleets converted from civilian life.
Heavy Metal Nomads

The outside is harsh, and useful stopping points are few and far between. But inside of their armored, rumbling homes, this faction found survival and even comfort, with every household protected from the elements as they roll from place to place.
Trained By Nature

Experience is the best teacher, and between the flora, the fauna, the geography, and the other people, fighting in war has never been a complicated affair, as soldiers only need training for obedience.
Daring Aviators

Enamored with flight and its military capabilities, pilots are given immense leeway in their choice of armaments, access to supplies, and promises of post-war tribute, ever competing to show their powers of swift destruction.
Steel Knights

Perhaps a cavalry culture at one point, tank crews have replaced small circles of knights as the storied spearpoint of the military; tales abound of grease-smeared heroes struggling forward through the enemy ranks, returning from the smoke with machinery broken but heads held high in victory.
Special Forces Focused

Constantly studying and improving, all soldiers are held to only the highest standards of planning, reflexes, and an eye for opportunity on the battlefield, whether in pressurized wet-suits, deep caverns, or the most complex artificial cityscapes.
Cloud Leviathans

Some strange historical happenstance directed this factions energy towards bigger and tougher aircraft, with roaring engines and vast hallways; their first military spacecraft were likely these flying monstrosities simply modified with extra thrust to break free of orbit.
Moving Fortresses

A rarity even on the most wide-open planets due to the requirement for powerful manufacturing centers, this factions vehicles can become truly gargantuan, as gravity repulsors provide lift merely as a support to these mighty land-ships incredible weight where other factions would use them for aircraft.
Power-Armored

Often the result of particularly murky environs like swamp planets and hollow worlds, power armored troops are an interesting alternative to the development of both tanks and flying gunships where the environment and the economy cannot support them.

Culturally insular, or maybe just boring, this factions signals fail to find purchase in the scattered stars between major nodes, such that border worlds and outposts know little about their ruling empire beyond the date of tax day or the founding mythology.
Air Health
Armor Health
Infantry Health
+5% [dustColored] on Empire per Assimilated Minor Faction

This System is under the surveillance of an Cloak Detection Probe, giving vision to {0}

Your ships are also natively Cloaked, which allows you to discreetly and safely explore the galaxy. Later, Cloak Detection modules will allow others to detect your fleets and Home System (but stronger Cloaking measures will allow you to remain undetected).

Creating Sanctuaries is the Umbral Choir way of colonizing. A Sanctuary is Cloaked to other Empires who don’t have Cloak Detection modules. It's even possible to have a Sanctuary on a colonized Planet!

You can get access to these modules by unlocking the corresponding Technology in the Military Quadrant. Keep in mind that there are multiple levels of Cloaking, and therefore multiple levels of Cloak Detection tech.

Basic Scanners

Recent groundbreaking improvements in radio-astronomy allow for distant planets to be closer than ever! A planet in a system light-years away can be scanned, modeled, and beamed back in a matter of months, allowing both scientists and civilians to get a clear glimpse of what the galaxy truly looks like.
Sets the Curiosity Detection Level to 2 (Reveals Uncommon and Common Curiosities) Sets the Curiosity Expedition Power to 1 (Explore Common Curiosities)
Sets the Curiosity Detection Level to 3 (Reveals Rare Curiosities) Sets the Curiosity Expedition Power to 2 (Explore Uncommon Curiosities)
Sets the Curiosity Detection Level to 4 (Reveals Epic Curiosities) Sets the Curiosity Expedition Power to 3 (Explore Rare Curiosities)
Sets the Curiosity Expedition Power to 4 (Explore Epic Curiosities)

Fleets can go back to where they came from when arriving in the Singularity. Players can retry Space Battles and Ground Battles.

Bonuses from the construction at the top of the queue are applied while it is being constructed (does not apply to Wonders, Resource generators, or Improvements that are Singularity or Population related) Movement points are automatically refilled for arriving fleets. Heroes have no Assignment Cooldown

Population Migration

Enabling this allows population from yours and other empires to leave and go to another empire that has better living conditions. Disabling this will entirely disable this mechanic, and no population will leave.
True
Population will migrate to other empires.
False
Population will not migrate to other empires.
